tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: It was a very good experience with the dr he is very friendly and the way he treat the way a talk and the way he explain and would really suggest dr in my refrence

tags: None
review: I have net a lot of doctors off late regarding different issues but off them all I felt the best here. He had the willingness and strength  to connect with the every patient. His tone had the empathy that should be there in every doctor which unfortunately many dont have as there are so many continues patients but some doctors have the ability to retain it .. he made sure to completely hear me out and explain all my doubts.. most importantly he had a smile on his face entire time..  I was relaxed after the consultation. And his fees being a cardiologist was on particularly lower side which shows he cares about people and is committed to his profession. God bless !!

tags: None
review: **** ******* expirians is very well. I had breathing problems last two three months. I wisit  other    asthma doctors for  this problem. But they can't find whay this happen to me. But when I meet Dr. Surinder hansra they'll quickly explain what happened with me.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Booking appointment was smooth, i was asked whether i have any fever, cough or temperature to which i said no. They gave me an appointment on next day. When i reached the clinic my temp, oximeter reading and My bp was checked after which i was allowed to see the dr. He was polite and nice initially as i told him i need an ecg report for my company which is an annual ritual as i am from aviation. He asked of any history to which i told him that i was covid positive more than an month back and i have completely recovered and cleared by Dr and BMC. His behaviour was completely changed *** ****** ******** **** why didn’t you inform us before to which i said that i was never asked before and its a history now and my Treating dr has already said that i can resume my regular life. Still I apologised to him telling him that i had no intention to hide or else i would have not even told you now and there was no way you coukd find out. His assistant did my ecg, he had to take 2 reports because his machine had some issue. After the report he said its normal and asked me to step out of his cabin. His assistant came with the reports and gave it to me. When i had some doubts about my reports about things written on it, ** *** ****** *** said its written in medical terms you wont understand and asked me to leave. I asked myself he charged me consulting fees of 1000 rs and 300 extra for ecg but he doesn’t want to reply to my questions. I felt ao humiliated **  ** * *** **** ********* ***** ** ** ***** *** **** ********* **** ******* * *** ***** ********* * **** ** ******** **** *** ****** ** ** ** **** ** *** ****** ****** **** ******** ** **** **** ** *** ** ** **** *** ****** ******** * ***** ******* **** *** *** *** ********** ** ** *** *** ** *****
reply_text: Dear patient, the question of my behavior changing after knowing your recent covid status does not arise as I have been treating cardiac covid patients since the start of the pandemic. However not disclosing your recent covid status knowly in the current scenario seems irresponsible as it can pose a risk to the other patients and the staff. I had informed you that the ECG is normal and you were asked to step out as your consultation was completed and we had to complete the sanitization of the clinic before the arrival of the next patient. All medical tests are reported in medical terminologies and the patient are usually told whether it is normal or not. All charges are already displayed in the waiting area and on practo. I still apologize if despite all my sincere efforts you did not have a satisfactory experience.

tags: None
review: *** ** *** **** ******* * **** **** ******* **** ************** explained the matter very well. He came across someone who is not to worried about how he will earn from patients, but more concerned about the well being. Also he took interest in the overall well-being and not just the case we went with.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: My Dad got an heart attack & was admitted to nearest hospital. The next day I called doctor & explained the scenario, doctor asked for reports & advised me for angiography. There was one major block of 99 % We did angioplasty & the process went well. Now dad is at home even at night 10.30 PM I message doctor & he always replies immediately. Great Experience. Thank You Doctor.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: The respected Dr Hansra is very good. Can just figure out your problem on hearing it. Was facing immense stress and was suspecting some cardiac issues with myself. Got in touch with dr Hansra. He was quick to identify that the problem is related to stress and anxiety and not cardiac. gave me valuable advise. Very patiently heard me. Very friendly but a true professional.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: Dr. Hansra was very dubious and recommended us to a do a central IV to my grandmother. He forced us into saying that if we don't follow his advice, the patient might get a paralysis stoke. We disapproved even after a lot of brunt by him and patient was actually shifted to general ward that very day. I don't recommend him at all.
reply_text: central IV line are adviced if peripheral veins are not available or certain drugs cannot be given by peripheral veins. central IV line is not a therapy for stroke prevention rather it is used to give drugs to control irregular heart rate that can cause paralytic stroke. It is fortunate that your patient stabilised without need for further IV drugs. Need for these procedures have to be explained in advance.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,Value for money,
review:
** ** * **** ************* ******* Explains the issue and the treatment he is suggesting very clearly. Mostly all doctors check you ask for issues and prescribe medicines, however he takes the effort to make the patient understand what he thinks the problem is in a layman's language and then also gives you the treatment with clear understanding about why he is prescribing this medication.
My experience with him is very good. I am taking his treatment since last 6 months.
